rule: The response must convey its message clearly while adhering to the complex syntax and word choice that characterizes Shakespearean dialogue or monologue.
input: Compose a message about enduring love using Shakespearean dialogue.
output: By all the fruits of heaven, sweet Helen! Howbeit, thou dost present to my thoughts an occasion cozier than that lily-white morn in which thy temples did behold saint Raphael's healing hand. For though I hold not on with more enticement for earthly din, yet a spirit doth prompt me most sincerely to stay and partake of the feast devised by thy bounteous hands. Thou hast conjured up a vision far sweeter than that vision in mine imagination hath ever beheld; therefore, I am bound by cords celestial not to refuse thy gracious kindness. Let us henceforth meet in private chambers where we may discourse with more privacy and affection, and thence proceed to the meal prepared for thee.
